jchrest.domainSpecifics.fixations

Class CentralFixation

  • java.lang.Object
    • jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation
      • jchrest.domainSpecifics.fixations.CentralFixation

  • public class CentralFixation
extends Fixation
    A Fixation that, when constructed, will suggest either the absolute centre Square of a Scene to fixate on or, if there is no absolute centre in the Scene passed to #this#make(jchrest.domainSpecifics.Scene, int) (either Scene.getHeight() or Scene.getWidth() for the Scene passed to #this#make( jchrest.domainSpecifics.Scene, int) returns an even number), a Square around the absolute centre is returned. NOTE: CentralFixations do not require any Fixations to have been added by the Perceiver associated with the Chrest model that invokes #this#make(jchrest.domainSpecifics.Scene, int) prior to this invocation in order to propose a Square to fixate on.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class jchrest.domainSpecifics.Fixation

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Square make(Scene scene, int time)
      This method should not be invoked directly to make #this since it will not be guaranteed that the instance variables of #this pertaining to its performance will be set by the concrete implementation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CentralFixation

        public CentralFixation(int timeThatDecidingUponThisStarts,
                       int timeTakenToDecideUponThis)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        timeThatDecidingUponThisStarts - The time (in milliseconds) that it will be in the domain when #this starts to be decided upon.
        timeTakenToDecideUponThis - The time (in milliseconds) that it takes to decide upon the Square that #this will fixate on after starting deliberation on it.

    • Method Detail

      • make

        public Square make(Scene scene,
                   int time)
        Description copied from class: Fixation
        This method should not be invoked directly to make #this since it will not be guaranteed that the instance variables of #this pertaining to its performance will be set by the concrete implementation. Neither can it be guaranteed that the jchrest.lib.Scene that #this is made in context of is the jchrest.lib.Scene that previous Fixations in the same set have been made in context of. Use #this#perform(jchrest.lib.Scene, int) instead.
        Specified by:
        make in class Fixation
        Parameters:
        scene -
        time -
        Returns:
        A non-blind Square either at the absolute centre or around the absolute centre of the Scene specified or null if Scene.isBlind() evaluates to Boolean.TRUE (may happen if the Scene has been generated using jchrest.architecture.VisualSpatialField#getSceneEncoded() or #this#getPerformanceTime() is later than the time specified. If invoking jchrest.lib.Scene#getWidth() and jchrest.lib.Scene#getHeight() on the Scene returned by jchrest.architecture.Perceiver#getCurrentScene produces odd numbers then the Square returned will be the absolute centre of the Scene. Even numbers for jchrest.lib.Scene#getWidth() and jchrest.lib.Scene#getHeight() will result in a random choice between Squares that are around the absolute centre of the Scene with equal probability.
